docs.text: " there's nothing new under the sun " is a phrase often used when the speaker actually means " let's find something to copy . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course there are very few completely original ideas .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even earth-shattering concepts are built upon the vast body of human experience .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there is , after all , no need to re-invent the wheel time after time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: recently it seems that hollywood doesn't feel the need to even re-write the script .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: my understanding of the word " sequel " is a continuation of the story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film industry has defined the word to mean reshooting the original with minor changes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: have an overwhelming desire to see an inferior version of brian depalma's adaptation of the steven king novel ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is your dream come true .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: rachel ( emily bergl ) , a high school outcast , is beginning to notice weird things happening around her .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: doors slam shut by themselves .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: glass globes blow up .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: her mother has severe mental problems and her father is absent .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a popular boy unexpectedly asks her out .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the in-crowd conspires to embarrass her at a public event .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: any of this sound familiar ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: once the audience catches on that this is the same story as " carrie " , there's little to do but wait for the inevitable ending .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the effects are a bit better this time around , but the film doesn't work nearly as well .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are a couple of minor plot differences .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: rachel lives with foster parents because her mother is institutionalized .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the boys at her school are portrayed as even more evil than in the original .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they keep score of their scoring with points given for each conquest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and , uh , there must be other story changes but none stand out .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one nice touch is the casting of amy irving again as sue snell .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: over 20 years ago she was the one girl who tried to help carrie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now a high school counselor , she befriends rachel , but her character's potential is squandered .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's too much about sue that doesn't make sense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after the slaughter when carrie kills most of her classmates , sue is driven mad and spends time in the institution that rachel's mother is in .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: still living in the same small town , the woman with a well-known history of mental problems is hired as a high school counselor ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sue tells rachel that her telekinesis is a genetic disease .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this may be the one original idea in the film , but the reasoning behind describing psychic powers as a " disease " is never explained .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sue's eventual fate is an admission by director katt shea and writer rafael moreu that they had an interesting character but couldn't figure out what to do with her .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: blink and you'll miss it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some of the events are filmed in black and white , but the rationale for this is unknown .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it doesn't add anything and the choice of scenes appears somewhat random .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " the rage " retains some of the trappings of " carrie " without the meaning .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the first film the color red was a motif connected to carrie's onset of powers at the same time she began menstruating .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here there's an abundance of red , but for no apparent purpose .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the casting of high school jocks and cheerleaders as villains is beginning to wear thin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one might be lead to suspect that most filmmakers were unpopular in school and the history of teenage films is an extended cinematic revenge of the nerds .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the biggest mistake the film makes is including clips of the original .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: seeing sissy spacek on the screen only points to the quality of that film - and the flaws in this one .
docs.label: negative
